sen.j: 三野石守（みののいしもり)は奈良時代の人。
sen.e: MINO no Ishimori was a person of Nara period.
MINO no Ishimori was a person of the Nara period.
MINO no Ishimori was a person of the Nara period.
He was a follower of OTOMO no Tabito (poet).
He was a follower of OTOMO no Tabito (poet).
He was a follower of OTOMO no Tabito (poet).

sen.j: 天平2年、大宰帥大伴旅人が大納言に任ぜられて帰京する際、別に海路をとって上京した。
sen.e: When Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices) OTOMO no Tabito was appointed Dainagon (chief councilor of state) and returned to Nara in 730, he separately went to Nara by sea.
When Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices) OTOMO no Tabito was appointed Dainagon (chief councilor of state) and returned to Nara in 730, he separately went to Nara by sea.
When Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices) OTOMO no Tabito was appointed Dainagon (chief councilor of state) and returned to Nara in 730, he separately went to Nara by sea.

sen.j: 万葉集に２首の歌がある。
sen.e: His two poems were included in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).
His two poems were included in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).
His two poems were included in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).

sen.j: 『続日紀』の延暦5年12月条に同名の陰陽助が登場するが、別人とみられる。
sen.e: Although Onmyo no suke (Assistant Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) with the same name appeared in the article of December 786 in "Shoku Nihongi" (Continuation of Chronicles of Japan), he is considered to be the different person.
sen.cmt: 原文の「続日紀」は「続日本紀」のことと思われますので、そのように訳出しました。（ウェブではこの部分の記述は確認できませんでした）
sen.e: Although Onmyo no suke (Assistant Director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) with the same name appeared in the article of December 786 in "Shoku Nihongi" (Continuation of Chronicles of Japan), he is considered to be a different person.
